title: Asia Pacific: Citi Launches Regional Shop with Points on Amazon.com
summary: Hong Kong - Citi announced that Citi customers can now use rewards points for purchases at Amazon.com-the global site offering access to a wide range of products from retailers. Citi already offers a capability in India via Amazon's local country site when checking out to use points to redeem Amazon Gift Cards.
tag-1: Asia Pacific: Citi Launches Regional Shop with Points on Amazon.com
tag-3: Hong Kong – Citi announced that Citi customers can now use rewards points for purchases at Amazon.com—the global site offering access to a wide range of products from retailers. Citi already offers a capability in India via Amazon's local country site when checking out to use points to redeem Amazon Gift Cards.
tag-4: The collaboration also offers Citi card holders rebates and free shipping in a number of consumer markets across Asia Pacific.
tag-5: Starting in February, Citi credit card holders in Thailand who shop at Amazon.com will be able to use their Citi ThankYou Rewards, Citi's global credit card rewards program, to pay for purchases at checkout. Singapore, Philippines and Australia will follow in the first half of 2017 with the plan to roll out the Shop with Points program across Asia during 2017.
tag-6: "At Citi we are focused on making banking easier for our customers by leveraging digitization, mobile technology and innovation which includes delivering a remarkable client experience in key digital ecosystems. We have seen that the rapid adoption of mobile and other digital channels has truly transformed how people shop, and we are delighted that Citi cardholders in Asia Pacific can now shop with points on Amazon," said Anand Selva, Head of Asia Pacific Consumer Banking for Citi.
tag-7: With this new offering, Citi credit card customers can enjoy complimentary shipping on qualified purchases and get an additional 10 percent rebate up to certain amounts across a number of markets with a minimum spend. Rebates and qualified free shipping will be offered across Philippines, Taiwan, Singapore and Hong Kong at various promotion periods within first quarter of 2017.
tag-8: The announcement marks another key digital relationship that reinforces Citi's objective to be increasingly relevant in key digital ecosystems where the banks' clients are more active.
tag-9: During 2016 Citi's Consumer Banking business in Asia Pacific, that spans 12 of 19 global consumer markets, was transformed into a model that is simpler, dramatically faster, more scalable and far more digital.
tag-10: In 2016, on average, Citi announced a new digital innovation or partnership fortnightly. Today, more than half of the bank's Consumer Bank clients use digital channels with mobile being the fastest growing channel with 35 percent growth year-on-year. One out of every four new credit card accounts acquired comes from digital sources and over 50 percent of the bank's clients are actively using digital banking channels, up from 30 percent three years ago.
tag-11: During 2016 Citi announced strategic partnerships in leading digital ecosystems across the region. Some of these included Alipay and WeChat in China and Line in Thailand and Taiwan. The bank also formed digital credit card partnerships with Amazon, Airbnb, Grab, Uber, Lazada and Air Asia in various countries across Asia. The bank's social media followers in Asia grew from 3m to over 10m during 2016.
tag-12: During 2016 Citi launched the newly-refreshed Citi Mobile App across the region featuring easy-to-use functionality and interface such as Snapshot and Touch ID, which has seen over 2 million downloads to-date. The bank also was the first to launch Voice Biometrics across the region which has since received more than 700,000 sign-ups from customers with over 1 million clients consenting.
tag-13: These investments have support growth with Citi reporting strong financials in Asia during 2016. In the fourth quarter 2016 the bank reported revenues of $3.2 billion up 4 percent year-on-year, with EBIT of $1.2 billion up 18 percent year-on-year. For 2016 overall, Citi Asia Pacific generated revenues of $13.2 billion and EBIT and net income of $4.9 billion and $3.3 billion, respectively.
tag-14: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
